intro: Schoenoplectus multisetus, commonly known as the many-bracted sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and shallow water areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Schoenoplectus multisetus plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
